name: MSCRMPackageDeployer
description: Deploys a CRM Package using the CRM Package Deployer PowerShell Cmdlets
author: Wael Hamze
helpMarkDown: More information on CRM Package Deployer can be found [here](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn647420.aspx)

inputs.name: packagePath
inputs.label: Package DLL Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The full path to the assembly that contains the package definition

inputs.name: pdTimeout
inputs.label: Package Deployment Timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: The timespan notation for the timeout value of a package deployment operation. The format applied is '[d:]h:mm:ss', where d is optional For example: 1:30:00 means wait up to 1 hr and 30 mins for the package deployment operation to complete. 1:14:30:00 means wait up to 1 day, 14 hrs, and 30 mins for the package deployment operation to complete.

inputs.name: crmConnectionTimeout
inputs.label: Connection Timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Crm connection timeout in minutes

inputs.name: unpackFilesDirectory
inputs.label: Unpack Files Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use in conjuction with agentdesktopzipfile parameter in the ImportConfig.xml

inputs.name: runtimePackageSettings
inputs.label: Runtime Package Settings
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use to specifiy additional runtime parameters such as LCID=1033

inputs.name: useAsyncMode
inputs.label: Use Async Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set to true will perform operation in asynchronous mode using ExecuteAsyncRequest
